--- In gladiator@yahoogroups.com, Tom Tildrum <tevildoii@y...> wrote:
> I'm not sure how effective Whirlwind is... my guess is
 "not very".

Its biggest effect has been pushing opponents away.  When the soldier 
 outclasses opponents, I'd say Whirldwind is effective.  I used 
Whirlwind once in my "Slime Lords", but the strength is a joke.

>Charge could be altered to automatically target an opponent that's in 
front of the soldier (perhaps in a 10-o'clock-to-2-o'clock range)... 
that would increase it's usefulness.

The biggest use I've had out of "charge" was using it to run away from 
an opponent or catch up to an opponent.

> Boomerang should definitely be altered--a limit on the number of 
boomerangs that can be thrown, and a wider range of spots at which the 
boomerang will cause damage in its flight.

Also, rework the duration of boomerangs.  They can last seemingly 
favor.  I'd like to rework the range to be confined to a relatively 
smaller area and instead of forming a web, forming a box around the 
soldier.
 
> Elves--what can I say. They throw too many rocks. I used to run 
around after completing a mission, shooting down all the stray rocks 
that enemy elves had thrown that were still ricocheting around the 
map.

I do that a lot to speed things up.

>I'd like to see a limit on the rocks an elf can throw at a time... 
once the maximum (which would increase with level) had been reached, 
the previously thrown rocks would disappear.

I can agree to that.  Except I believe the game should take into 
consideration the size of a map when determining the max number of 
rocks per elf.  Smaller maps = less rocks.  My "The Weakest Link 2" 
really illustrates problems with seemingly too many rocks.
